articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel is under growing pressure to get more aid into Gaza as the war causes widespread destruction and hunger.
articles.title: More aid trucks expected to roll into Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy appealed to U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping on Sunday to join an upcoming peace summit as his country struggles to stave off unrelenting attacks by Russia in its 27-month-old invasion.
articles.title: Zelenskiy, from Kharkiv, urges Biden, Xi to join peace summit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Leaders from China, Japan, and South Korea will meet for the first three-way talks in four years on Monday in Seoul, as they try to revive trade and security dialogues hampered by global tensions.
articles.title: China's premier to hold rare summit with U.S.-allied South Korea, Japan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te again offered talks with China on Sunday following two days of Chinese war games near the island, saying he looked forward to enhancing mutual understanding and reconciliation.
articles.title: After China drills, Taiwan president again offers talks

articles.author: Andrius Sytas
articles.description: Gitanas Nauseda's backing in his bid for a second term could be highest in the country since it split from the Soviet Union.
articles.title: Lithuanian Nauseda calls victory in presidential election

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: Twelve parties in Moldova clinched a pact on Sunday committing them to act in favour of European Union membership for the ex-Soviet state as the campaign for an October referendum on European integration heats up.
articles.title: Twelve Moldovan parties clinch pro-Europe pact, but not all back president

articles.author: Andy Bruce
articles.description: Britain's Conservative Party will introduce mandatory national service for 18-year-olds if it wins the national election on July 4, comprising military or community participation, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said on Sunday.
articles.title: Lagging in polls, UK Conservatives pitch national service at 18

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The third heat wave suffocating dozens of states in Mexico could give way on Sunday to torrential rains, hail and even whirlwinds during the afternoon in the center of the country, meteorologists said.
articles.title: Experts warn of hail, whirlwinds in Mexico after new heat record in the capital

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin, making his third foreign trip since his re-election in March, arrived in ex-Soviet Uzbekistan on Sunday and met with his counterpart Shavkat Mirziyoyev ahead of the start of formal talks.
articles.title: Russian President Putin arrives in Uzbekistan, third foreign trip since re-election

articles.author: Samuel Mckeith
articles.description: The number of dead is more than twice the estimated figure local media earlier reported.
articles.title: More than 670 feared dead in Papua New Guinea landslide
